bug.author: FGeri
bug.summary: [BUG] Flipping augmentations return wrong transformation matrices
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
RandomHorizontalFlip and RandomVerticalFlip return wrong transformation matrices in case of flipping. Transforming a [x,y,1] vector with the returned transformation matrix results in values with +1 off in the x and respectively in the y dimensions. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: <denchmark-code>>>> import kornia as K >>> input = torch.tensor([[[[0., 0., 0.], [0., 0., 0.], [0., 1., 1.]]]]) >>> hflip = K.augmentation.RandomHorizontalFlip(p=1.0,return_transform=True) >>> _, T_h = hflip(input) >>> h_data = torch.tensor([[0.,1.,2.], [0.,0.,0.], [1.,1.,1.]]) >>> T_h @ h_data tensor([[[3., 2., 1.], [0., 0., 0.], [1., 1., 1.]]])
>>> T_h tensor([[[-1., 0., 3.], [ 0., 1., 0.], [ 0., 0., 1.]]]) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Returned transformation matrix should be for RandomHorizontalFlip : <denchmark-code>tensor([[[-1., 0., w-1], [ 0., 1., 0. ], [ 0., 0., 1. ]]]) </denchmark-code>
Returned transformation matrix should be for RandomVerticalFlip : <denchmark-code>tensor([[[ 1., 0., 0 ], [ 0., -1., h-1], [ 0., 0., 1. ]]]) </denchmark-code>
